intro: Aeranthes micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Marantaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that often grow in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
